cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles SE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the north-western Bahamas on Friday, then along or just off the east-central Florida coast Saturday before crossing the peninsula toward the northeast Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast near Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the north-western Bahamas (excluding Andros Island)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East coast of Florida from West Palm Beach northward and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Chance (27%) of tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) peaking late Sunday; gusty squalls possible earlier
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge impact currently expected for Jacksonville
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Saturday night through Sunday could total 2–4 inches, locally higher in persistent bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents and occasional lightning in squalls may disrupt vessel traffic and cargo handling
